posts.cooked: We are using the FollowPathCommand from PathPlanner and we are not sure how to set our odometry to the initial pose of the path. We have tried several things and sometimes it would work and now our odometry is inverted on the Y-axis and won’t reset. Our code is here: Code

link_counts.title: GitHub - Isotope-Robotics/FRC-2024: 2024 Robot Code for Crescendo

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked:
I don’t know if this is the correct answer, but in your path planner app on your computer, under autonomous modes, there’s a checkbox that says “preset starting pose” where you can set your starting pose

I bet there’s also a way to seed it with an April tag but I haven’t gotten there yet

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
We’ve not done swerve, but in all the testing I have done, the craziness at the start of path following is PathPlanner executing the “Path find to path” step.

By changing out some of the replanning config options when we configure our AutoBuilder we’ve seen better results.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked:
Have you tried doing swerve.setPose() and passing in the .getInitialPose() of your trajectory?

If this doesn’t work, try using SmartDashboard to print the odometry pose and see what’s happening
Yes we have been doing that. Its just inverted all of a sudden and we dont know why.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked:
Ok then the problem is most likely in your swerve, not path planner. When you drive the robot forward, does odometry say x is increasing or decreasing?

Forward should be positive x, left should be positive y
In Tele it drove correctly and the odometry plots correctly.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked: Are you making sure in driver station you have the right side selected for the auto youre attempting?
Yes, we figured it out as out auto function wasn’t calling the set initial pose correctly.
